briefTitle: Management of Etonogestrel Subdermal Implant-related Bleeding
officialTitle: Management of Etonogestrel Subdermal Implant-related Bleeding in US Women: a Prospective, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Trial.

interventions.name: Doxycycline
otherNames: Adoxa, Alodox, Avidoxy, Bio-Tab, Doryx, Doxy Lemmon, Doxy-Caps, Monodox, Morgidox, Ocudox, Oracea, Oraxyl, Periostat, Vibra-Tabs, Vibramycin

summary:
This is a double-blinded, randomized, prospective placebo-controlled clinical trial to be conducted within the Mayo Clinic and the Mayo Clinic Health System.

The goal of the research study is to gather information to determine whether Doxycycline is effective for the treatment of unacceptable bleeding associated with the etonogestrel subdermal implant (ESI), as compared to placebo.

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: After initial treatment up to 39 weeks
